intro: Boehmeria sanguinea, commonly known as red-flowered nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive reddish tinge. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom during the summer months. Boehmeria sanguinea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
